intro: Cajanus scarabaeoides var. pedunculatus, commonly known as the red gram bean, is a leguminous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It produces small, elongated pods containing edible seeds that are rich in protein and used in various cuisines. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has trifoliate leaves with hairy surfaces. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm climate with adequate rainfall. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it is cultivated for both its seeds and as a forage crop.
